trans-unit.source: The AuthorizationRule class allows you to programmatically access and modify the <xref uid="langword_csharp_authorization" name="authorization" href=""></xref> section of a configuration file.
This class cannot be inherited.
The AuthorizationRule class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `authorization` section of a configuration file.

This type is part of a group that includes the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationSection>, the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRuleCollection>, and the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRuleAction> types.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationSection> can update the configuration information at any level in the configuration hierarchy.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule"></xref> class using the passed object.
The AuthorizationRule constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule"></xref> object to use to initialize the new instance.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule"></xref> action.
At run time, the authorization module iterates through `allow` and `deny` elements until it finds the first access rule that fits a particular user.
It then grants or denies access to a URL resource depending on whether the first access rule found is `allow` or `deny`.
Access is allowed by default.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRuleAction"></xref> values.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.
The object to compare with the current object.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the objects are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Serves as a hash function for this object.
An integer representing the hash code for the current object.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets the roles associated with the resource.
The Roles property is a list of roles that are granted or denied access to the resource.
There must be at least one value in either the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule.Users%2A> property collection or the Roles property collection, or both.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection"></xref> collection containing the roles whose authorization must be verified.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets the users associated with the resource.
The Users property is a list of users that are granted or denied access to the resource.
There must be at least one value in either the Users property collection or the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule.Roles%2A> property collection, or both.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection"></xref> collection containing the users whose authorization must be verified.
Gets the verbs associated with the resource.
The Verbs property is a comma-separated list of HTTP transmission methods that are granted or denied access to the resource.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection"></xref> collection containing the verbs whose authorization must be verified.
